intro: Rimaria microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded rimaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, temperate habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its fruit is a small, dry schizocarp with two mericarps, each containing a single seed. Rimaria microsperma is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
